required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Study of CX1003 (Kanitinib) in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Multicenter, Open-label, Dose Escalation/Expansion Study Evaluating the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Efficacy of CX1003 (Kanitinib) in the Patients With Relapsed Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

collaborator.agency: National Cancer Center/Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences and Peking Union Medical College

brief_summary.textblock: CX1003 is a novel multi-target tyrosine kinase inhibitor that is designed to primarily inhibit vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2 (VEGFR2) and hepatocyte growth factor receptor (HGFR/MET). This study aimed to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics, and antitumor activity of CX1003 in patients with refractory advanced or metastatic solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) by NCI CTCAE 5.0: Dose Escalation Stage
primary_outcome.time_frame: First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum tolerated dose (MTD): Dose Escalation Stage
primary_outcome.time_frame: First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003
primary_outcome.description: The maximum tolerated dose (MTD) was defined as the highest dose for a given schedule that was expected to cause DLTs in no more than 33% of patients.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003
First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters: Time to reach the maximum plasma concentration (Tmax)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003
First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters: Apparent body clearence from plasma (CL/F)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 5 weeks after initial administration of CX1003

secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate (ORR) was defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) per RECIST 1.1.

Progression-free survival (PFS) was defined as the time from the start date of study drug to the date of the first radiologically documented progressive disease (PD) per RECIST 1.1 or death due to any cause.
Disease Control Rate (DCR) was defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) per RECIST 1.1.

Duration of response (DOR) was defined as the time from first documented response (partial response (PR) or complete response (CR)) to the date of first documented disease progression (PD) or death due to any cause, among patients with a confirmed PR or CR per RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety profile as assessed by the incidence, duration, and severity of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of CX1003 to 30 days after last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence, duration, and severity of AEs measured by laboratory assessments and physical findings according to NCI CTCAE 5.0.

arm_group.description: Treatment will comprise 2 periods: a 4-day single dose period, followed by a period of daily-dose in continuous 28-day treatment cycle (the 1st cycle) or 21-day treatment cycles (the 2nd cycle and beyond).

intervention.description: Oral dose A 4-day single dose period, followed by a period of daily-dose in continuous 28-day treatment cycle (the 1st cycle) or 21-day treatment cycles (the 2nd cycle and beyond) Dosage range: 25 mg, 50mg, 75mg, 100mg

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

facility.name: National Cancer Center/Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences and Peking Union Medical College
